newsitem.title: CHINA: Half of Shanghai stock trading done off-floor.
newsitem.headline: Half of Shanghai stock trading done off-floor.

text.p: About half of the stock trading on the Shanghai stock exchange is now being done in the form of off-floor transactions through the exchange's computerised system, the Shanghai Securities News said on Saturday.
The exchange started off-floor trading in October 1996 and the business has developed rapidly, enhancing the speed and accuracy of stock trading, the newspaper said.

A total of 800 stock trading offices from other parts of China have now been linked to the exchange's off-floor computerised system and 330 others in Shanghai have also been connected, the newspaper said.
